labels.analysis: The MCP Server is specifically designed to interact with the Internet Archive's Wayback Machine, providing tools to access archived web content. Its core functionality revolves around retrieving historical versions of websites and checking for available snapshots of any given URL. This allows users to access past versions of web pages, which can be useful for research, verification of historical data, or preservation of content that might no longer be available online. The server enhances applications with the capability to fetch archived web content, making it a valuable tool for web researchers, journalists, and developers.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server's main purpose is to facilitate access to archived web content, which is essential for research and historical data retrieval. This aligns with tools that help gather and analyze information from the web over time. Since the server's tools are tightly focused on archival content, no secondary labels are necessary. There is no need for a custom label as the predefined categories sufficiently capture the server's functionality.

tools.name: get_snapshots
tools.description: Get a list of available snapshots for a URL from the Wayback Machine

limit.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return (default: 100)

match_type.description: Type of URL matching to use (default: exact)

tools.name: get_archived_page
tools.description: Retrieve the content of an archived webpage from the Wayback Machine

url.description: URL of the page to retrieve

original.description: Whether to get the original content without Wayback Machine banner (default: false)

server_info_crawled.name: Wayback Machine Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Cyreslab-AI/wayback-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide access to archived web pages and snapshots from the Internet Archive's Wayback Machine. Retrieve historical versions of websites and check available snapshots for any URL. Enhance your applications with historical web content retrieval capabilities.

tools.name: get_snapshots
tools.description: Get a list of available snapshots for a URL from the Wayback Machine

limit.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return (default: 100)

match_type.description: Type of URL matching to use (default: exact)

tools.name: get_archived_page
tools.description: Retrieve the content of an archived webpage from the Wayback Machine

url.description: URL of the page to retrieve

original.description: Whether to get the original content without Wayback Machine banner (default: false)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Cyreslab-AI/wayback-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
